guide.introduction: This year my son was enamored of Advent calendars – the idea of getting a little something every day from Hanukkah to Christmas. He also wanted to give them as gifts to his friends. He came up with the idea of a calendar that contained Magic: the Gathering cards. This was a great rainy-day-off school project for the two of us. We put it together using paper and tape (and the cards, of course) in just about an hour or so.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This year my son was enamored of Advent calendars – the idea of getting a little something every day from Hanukkah to Christmas. He also wanted to give them as gifts to his friends. He came up with the idea of a calendar that contained Magic: the Gathering cards. This was a great rainy-day-off school project for the two of us. We put it together using paper and tape (and the cards, of course) in just about an hour or so.

Relevant parts
  • Booster packs of "Magic: the Gathering" or other cards
  • Pieces of large card stock poster board or cardboard (at least 14″x27″)
  • Pieces of 2″x3″ paper
  • ½" double-sided adhesive tape
  • Single-sided tape
Tools
  • Cutting mat
  • Markers or other decorating materials
  • Ruler
  • X-Acto knife

parts.text: Booster packs of "Magic: the Gathering" or other cards
Pieces of large card stock poster board or cardboard (at least 14″x27″)

lines.text: Start by cutting 2 pieces of paper to the right size.
lines.text_raw: Start by cutting 2 pieces of paper to the right size.

lines.text: Draw grid lines where you want the pockets to go. Leave at least 1/2 inch on each side of the card.
lines.text_raw: Draw grid lines where you want the pockets to go. Leave at least 1/2 inch on each side of the card.

lines.text: Cut 24 "pocket" pieces (2"x3"). You could also probably use post-it notes.
lines.text_raw: Cut 24 "pocket" pieces (2"x3"). You could also probably use post-it notes.

lines.text: Tape the pockets onto the grid using the single-sided tape.
lines.text_raw: Tape the pockets onto the grid using the single-sided tape.

lines.text: Using a card you don't care about as a guide, put the card in the pocket and score around the top half.
lines.text_raw: Using a card you don't care about as a guide, put the card in the pocket and score around the top half.

lines.text: Do not score all the way around; leave some parts uncut. Also, don't cut the tape from the pocket above.
lines.text_raw: Do not score all the way around; leave some parts uncut. Also, don't cut the tape from the pocket above.

lines.text: Decorate the front and label the pockets
lines.text_raw: Decorate the front and label the pockets

lines.text: Flip it over and put the cards in order in the pockets. Make sure you note where the #1 pocket is and go in the right order.
lines.text_raw: Flip it over and put the cards in order in the pockets. Make sure you note where the #1 pocket is and go in the right order.

lines.text: My son decided that the last day should contain a full booster pack as a special present.
lines.text_raw: My son decided that the last day should contain a full booster pack as a special present.

lines.text: Put double-sided tape in the gutters around the cards. Make sure the cards don't touch the tape.
lines.text_raw: Put double-sided tape in the gutters around the cards. Make sure the cards don't touch the tape.

lines.text: Put the back onto the front, carefully aligning the sides and press firmly to make sure they stick.
lines.text_raw: Put the back onto the front, carefully aligning the sides and press firmly to make sure they stick.

lines.text: Trim the edges to make sure both sides are the same height/width.
lines.text_raw: Trim the edges to make sure both sides are the same height/width.
